http://tolweb.org/tree/phylogeny.html
 
 http://www.sheps.com/kamitp/treeoflife.html
 
 
 Can anyone direct me to a really good depiction of the evolutionary tree of life?

post_info.post_title: Tree of Life...a search for the Holy Grail

I have heard it described more as a bush than a tree but don't know where to find a picture as of yet. emoticon_cool

Actually, the one you linked at the Tree of Life web project is a pretty good representation of the consensus phylogeny. If you click at the bottom of the picture on the page you linked, it will start depicting various stages going up the tree, with branches at each stage.
 
 There is also one that is a bit simpler at the Talk Origins Archive. It is part of the "29+ Evidences for Macroevolution" pages. This paper is just one line of evidence for common descent based on phylogeny.

http://tolweb.org/tree/phylogeny.html
 
 http://www.sheps.com/kamitp/treeoflife.html
 
 
 Can anyone direct me to a really good depiction of the evolutionary tree of life?

 
 Hey Jim, try the Bible. It works for me. emoticon_idea

Hey Jim, try the Bible. It works for me. 
 
 
 Hey this is great news! Hunter has found a really good depiction of the evolutionary tree of life IN THE BIBLE! So now all those creationists who haven't accepted evolution because it wasn't mentioned in the Bible won't have any excuses now!
